questions.question: 1. In heterogeneous catalysis of a gaseous reactants over solid catalyst:

answers.a: Reaction occurs on the surface of the catalyst.
answers.b: reaction occurs when the gases diffuse towards the surface of the catalyst.
answers.c: reaction occurs when the gases are about to desorb from the catalyst surface.
answers.d: reaction occurs after the desorption of reactants.

explanations.a: reaction starts as soon as both reactants adsorb closely on the surface of the catalyst.
explanations.b: the reactants have to adsorb on the catalyst surface to react.
explanations.c: reactions complete while the reactants are on the surface of the catalyst, the rate of desorption does not affect the rate of the reaction.
explanations.d: reaction cannot occur after the desorption of the reactants from the catalytic surface.

questions.question: 2. When body temperature is high, doctors advice consumption of light food. This is because:

answers.a: At high temperature the body is weak
answers.c: At high temperature certain enzymes get denatured and cannot function well.
answers.d: At high temperature co-enzymes are not available.

explanations.a: though the body is weak at higher temperatures, there is no correlation between light food and high temperature.
explanations.b: light food is not known to increase body temperature further.
explanations.c: catalysts and enzymes (which are mostly proteins) can get denatured at high temperatures making them inactive. Digesting heavy food may not be achieved properly.
explanations.d: co-enzymes may or may not be affected at high temperatures.

questions.question: 3. Can one follow the reduction of eosin by borohydride by measuring the absorbance of gold particles and why?

answers.a: yes, as the gold particles get used up in the reaction.
answers.b: no, as the gold particles are used up in the reaction.
answers.c: no, as the gold particles are catalysts and are regenerated back at the end of the reaction.
answers.d: yes, as the gold particles become colorless.

explanations.a: gold particles are catalysts and are used up temporarily.
explanations.b: gold particles are not used up permanently.
explanations.c: gold particles are catalysts and rendered free after the reaction, the absorbance maximum will be affected temporarily.

questions.question: 4. Why does the absorbance vs time plot become flat after some time:

answers.a: No more gold particles are available for reaction.
answers.c: sodium borohydride is left in excess.
answers.d: gold particles absorb all incoming light.

explanations.a: a lot of free gold particles are present in the solution at the end of the reaction.
explanations.b: reduction reaction is complete and no more eosin is available to absorb incoming radiation.
explanations.c: sodium borohydride does not absorb in the same range as others. Hence cannot affect the plot.
explanations.d: gold particles will not absorb all light.
